casebody.data:
In the MATTER OF: The Elvira H. JUBEL Trust No. ED 105758 Missouri Court of Appeals, Eastern District, DIVISION ONE. Filed: November 6, 2018 Richard A. Wunderlich, Jacqueline K. Graves, Co-Counsel, 600 Washington Ave, Suite 2500, Saint Louis, MO. 63101, for appellant. Michael W. Bartolacci, Maria G. Zschoche, Co-Counsel, One US Bank Plaza, Saint Louis, MO. 63101, for respondent. Before Roy L. Richter, P.J., Robert M. Clayton III, J., Angela T. Quigless, J.

ORDER

PER CURIAM.

Donald A. Jubel, Melissa Jubel Markwort, Lindsey M. Jubel, and Lance A. Jubel appeal from the order and judgment of the trial court declaring, in favor of Christine Ann Homan, the Sixth Amendment to the Indenture of Trust of Elvira H. Jubel invalid due to a lack of testamentary capacity and undue influence. We have reviewed the briefs of the parties and the record on appeal, and we find the trial court did not err. An extended opinion would have no jurisprudential purpose. We have, however, provided a memorandum setting forth the reasons for our decision to the parties for their use only. We affirm the judgment pursuant to MO. R. CIV. P. 84.16(b) (2018).
